description:
6/28/2022 – at approximately 3:05 p.m. at the RRFB (Rapid Rectangular Flashing Beacon) at the intersection of NE Jackson School Road and NE Estate Drive.
 
 Weather  was clear and the pavement surface was dry .  
 This crash involved a v ehicle versus juvenile pedestrian  where injuries  were  reported . 
 
 
 The d river was  traveling southbound at the speed limit listed on her GPS which was 35 mph. The speed 
posted on NE Jackson School Road was temporarily signed at 25 mph. Driver indicated that suddenly  3 
children started to run across the crosswalk from west to east. The driver was u nable to stop in time 
and made contact with one of the children. The witness  on scene  stated that they believed that based 
on how the children entered the roadway, a driver would not have had enough time to react to avoid a 
collision , they also did not believe the driver was exceeding the speed limit .   
 The report does not indicate whether the driver was cited .  
 Staff visited the location and found that the beacon was operating properly. S taff also checked sight 
distance at the beacon.   In this case  staff investigated stopping sight distance, ensuring the driver had 
adequate sight line to see, perceive, and stop for a pedestrian.   Sight distance needs are based on the 
speed of the roadway.   While the speed at  this location is still under review, staff w as conservative and 
evaluated the location to ensure it met the speed limit of 35 mph as well as the temporary 30 mph 
speed. Staff found the stopping sight distance to be adequate for a speed limit of 35 mph or below.

7/3/2022 – at 10:18 a.m. at just north of the NE Brookwood/Cornell intersection.
 
 Weather was clear and the pavement surface was dry.  
 This crash involved a single motorcycle vehicle crash which resulted in serious injuries.  
 
The driver was cited for careless driving, driving while suspended , and driving without insurance.  
 
The motorcycle was traveling south on NE Brookwood Pkwy. The driver was going too fast around the 
curve and crashed into the curb. The driver was ejected from the motorcycle , slid across the asphalt,  
and was stopped by a fence. Based on onsite measurements and witness statements, s peeds were 
estimated to be well over the posted speed limit.  
 Speeding and careless behavior were  factor s in this crash;  therefore,  Public Works staff did not visit the 
crash location.

7/3/2022 – at around 4:30 a.m. near the intersection of NE Tanasbourne Drive and NE Stucki Avenue.

 Weather : Unknown.
 
This crash involved a single vehicle crash which resulted in one fatality and serious injuries.  
 
This crash is still under investigation and details have not been released , however  early reports indicate 
excessive speed and alcohol may have been factors in the crash.
